t: Job 22
Eliphaz Accuses Job of Wickedness
Then*p Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said:
“Can*pn a man be profitable to God, Though*ld he who is wise may be profitable to himself?
Is*ild it*i any pleasure to the Almighty that you are righteous? Or*ld is*i it*i gain to*i Him*i that you make your ways blameless?
“Is*ld it because of your fear of Him that He corrects you, And*ld enters into judgment with you?
Is*ild not your wickedness great, And*ld your iniquity without end?
For*ld you have taken pledges from your brother for no reason, And*ld stripped the naked of their clothing.
You*ld have not given the weary water to drink, And*ld you have withheld bread from the hungry.
But*ld the mighty man possessed the land, And*ld the honorable man dwelt in it.
You*ld have sent widows away empty, And*ld the strength of the fatherless was crushed.
Therefore*ld snares are*i all around you, And*ld sudden fear troubles you,
Or*ld darkness so*i that*i you cannot see; And*ld an abundance of water covers you.
“Is*ln not God in the height of heaven? And*ld see the highest stars, how lofty they are!
And*ld you say, ‘What does God know? Can*ld He judge through the deep darkness?
Thick*ld clouds cover Him, so that He cannot see, And*ld He walks above the circle of heaven.’
Will*ld you keep to the old way Which*ld wicked men have trod,
Who*ld were cut down before their time, Whose*ld foundations were swept away by a flood?
They*ld said to God, ‘Depart from us! What*ld can the Almighty do to them?’
Yet*ld He filled their houses with good things;*i But*ld the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
“The*ln righteous see it*i and are glad, And*ld the innocent laugh at them:
‘Surely*ld our adversaries are cut down, And*ld the fire consumes their remnant.’
“Now*ln acquaint yourself with Him, and be at peace; Thereby*ld good will come to you.
Receive,*ld please, instruction from His mouth, And*ld lay up His words in your heart.
If*ld you return to the Almighty, you will be built up; You*ld will remove iniquity far from your tents.
Then*ld you will lay your gold in the dust, And*ld the gold*i of Ophir among the stones of the brooks.
Yes,*ld the Almighty will be your gold And*ld your precious silver;
For*ld then you will have your delight in the Almighty, And*ld lift up your face to God.
You*ld will make your prayer to Him, He*ld will hear you, And*ld you will pay your vows.
You*ld will also declare a thing, And*ld it will be established for you; So*ld light will shine on your ways.
When*ld they cast you*i down, and you say, ‘Exaltation will*i come!’*i Then*ld He will save the humble person.*i
He*ld will even*i deliver one who is not innocent; Yes,*ld he will be delivered by the purity of your hands.”
